page.title: 12LANDSCAPE
page.content: Millions of years ago the glaciers covering Strathnairn carried large rocks with them.These were left when the ice melted.They can still be seen all over our area.One on them on the road between Dunlichity and Brin has a birch tree growing from it. The land was once covered with forests of Caledonian pine.Wolves, bears,wild boar and lynx as well as the animals we see today lived among the trees.They were hunted by the lairds and the kings. Crofters grew crops and kept stock on the fertile land near the rivers even though they flooded after heavy rain when the snow on the hills melted.This still happens Much of the croft land became heather covered moorland so grouse could be raised for shooting.Some is still like this but three forestry groups are replanting the hillsides with conifers
